intro: Jumellea serpens, commonly known as the serpentine jumellea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in arid environments. Jumellea serpens is often found in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
